snippet: India’s caste-based affirmative action policy has transformed the taint of “backwardness,” as those of means benefit from a program meant to uplift the less fortunate.
abstract: India's caste-based affirmative action system for university admissions works to reward the powerful rather than uplift those in need; some rules forbid the wealthy from taking advantage of quotas, but those rules have not been implemented in many states and are widely ignored in others.

byline.contributor: Niharika Mandhana contributed reporting from Chennai and New Delhi.

lead_paragraph: India’s caste-based affirmative action policy has transformed the taint of “backwardness,” as those of means benefit from a program meant to uplift the less fortunate.

headline.seo: India’s Rich Benefit From Schools’ Affirmative Action
headline.main: With Affirmative Action, India’s Rich Gain School Slots Meant for Poor
headline.print_headline: With Affirmative Action, India’s Rich Gain School Slots Meant for Poor
